gameplay.gameobject

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.gameobject.GameObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Background, Bomb, BombPassPowerup, BombPowerup, Brick, DetonatorPowerup, Door, Explosion, FlamePassPowerup, FlamePowerup, GameActor, MockGameObject, SpeedPowerup, Wall, WallPassPowerup

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class which represents a basic game object with methods to implements base functionality common across to all game objects.
    Author:
    MF
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the model of the game object.

      • isDestroyable

        public boolean isDestroyable()
        Returns:
        true if the object can be destroyed, false if the object cannot be destroyed.

      • isSolid

        public boolean isSolid()
        Returns:
        true if the object is solid, false if it's not.

      • conductsExplosions

        public boolean conductsExplosions()
        Returns if the game object conducts explosions through it.
        Returns:
        a boolean true if explosions should pass through the object, false if object stops explosions.

      • hasCollided

        public boolean hasCollided(GameObject obj)
        Checks if the current gameobject has collided with another gameobject obj.
        Parameters:
        obj - -GameObject to check against
        Returns:
        true if the instance collides with obj, false if they do not collide.

      • getCollisionBoundaries

        public java.awt.Rectangle getCollisionBoundaries()
        Method generates a rectangle which represents the collision boundaries of the instance of GameObject
        Returns:
        a Rectangle which represents the collision boundaries of the GameObject.

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.Rectangle getLocation()
        Method returns the location of this GameObject as a rectangle populated with the location and size of the gameobject.
        Returns:
        rectangle whose x and y are the same as the top left location of the game object and whose width and heigh as the same as the gameobject's sprite.

        Method which removes GameObject instance from the gameboard.
